name: These Capitals Are 'Old' Quiz | Cities of the World | 10 Questions

questions.text: Austria's capital Vienna has an ancient name. Is it ?
questions.explanation:
Vindobona.

	Vienna was originally a Celtic settlement called Vindobona. It was taken over by the Romans in the 1st century BC.

questions.text: Spain's capital, Madrid was also called something else. What was it ?
questions.explanation:
All of these names.

	The earliest references to the City of Madrid date back to 800 AD. All the above names are mentioned in various references.

questions.text: Paris, France also had an earlier name. Was it ?
questions.explanation:
Lutetia.

	A tribe of Celtic peoples called the 'Parisii' founded the city and gave it the name Lutetia around the middle of the 3rd century BC.

questions.text: Turkey's capital, Ankara was known by another name. Was it ?
questions.explanation:
Angora.

	The Hittites occupied the site of Ankara since about 2000 BC.

questions.text: What about good old London Town ?
questions.explanation:
Londinium.

	London was founded as a communications center by the Romans shortly after they invaded Britain in AD 43.

questions.text: Dublin is the capital of Ireland, but what was its first name ?
questions.explanation:
Eblana.

	The first reference to Eblana appears in the writings of the 2nd century Alexandrian geographer Ptolemy.

questions.text: The capital of Japan is Tokyo. What was this city formerly called?
questions.explanation:
Edo & Yedo & Yeddo.

	Edo was founded in the twelfth century.  In 1868 Tokyo became the capital of Japan. Kyoto was the former capital.

questions.text: Budapest is the Hungarian capital. What was its first name ?
questions.explanation:
Aquincum.

	The Romans founded Aquincum in the 1st century AD. The site would later become the town of Obuda. In 1873 the towns of Obuda, Buda and Pest were combined to form Budapest.

questions.text: Cairo is the largest city in Africa and capital of Egypt. What was its former name?
questions.explanation:
Al Fustat.

	Memphis, a previous capital was located south of Cairo.

questions.text: China's capital Beijing, is also known as Peking, but what was an earlier name for the city ?
questions.explanation:
Khanbalik.

	The origins of the site of modern day Beijing can be traced back to the third millennium BC. Khanbalik was the name given to the city by Kublai Khan in 1272.
